author: wtopstaff
title: Fight Schedule
text:
By The Associated Press October 19, 2015 1:02 pm Oct. 23 
At the Celebrity Theatre, Phoenix (SHO), Rob Brant vs. Louis Rose, 10, middleweights. 
At Fantasy Springs Resort Casino, Indio, Calif., Joseph Diaz Jr. vs. Ruben Tamayo, 10, featherweights; Frankie Gomez vs. Jorge Silva, 10, welterweights. Oct. 24 
At CenturyLink Center, Omaha, Neb. (HBO), Terence Crawford vs. Dierry Jean, for Crawford’s WBO junior welterweight title; Mikael Zewski vs. Raymond Serrano, 10, welterweights. 
At Sheffield, England, Chris Eubank Jr. vs. Tony Jeter, 12, for Eubank’s WBA interim middleweight title; Gavin McDonnell vs. Jeremy Parodi, 12, for McDonnell’s European junior featherweight title; Leigh Wood vs. Josh Wale, 10, featherweights; Dave Allen vs. Adam Machaj, 10, heavyweights. Oct. 31 
At Houston (NBCSN), Jermell Charlo vs. Joachim Alcine, 10, junior middleweights; Tony Harrison vs. Cecil McCalla, 10, junior middleweights. Nov. 4 
At Kazan, Russia, Denis Lebedev vs. Lateef Kayode, 12, for Lebedev’s WBA World cruiserweight title; Alexander Povetkin vs. Mariusz Wach, 12, heavyweights; Rakhim Chakhkiev vs. Ola Afolabi, 12, cruiserweights; Cesar Cuenca vs. Eduard Troyanovsky, 12, for Cuenca’s IBF junior welterweight title. Nov. 6 
At The D Hotel & Casino, Las Vegas (SHO), Antoine Douglas vs. Les Sherrington, 10, middleweights. Nov. 7 
At Monte Carlo, Juergen Braehmer vs. Thomas Oosthuizen, 12, for Braehmer’s WBA World light heavyweight title; Yonfrez Parejo vs. Zhanat Zhakiyanov, 12, for Parejo’s interim WBA World bantamweight title; David Avanesyan vs. Charlie Navarro, 12, welterweights; Youri Kalenga vs. Roberto Bolonti, 10, cruiserweights; Amor Beladhj Ali vs. Jun Qiu Xiao, 12, junior featherweights. 
At the Thomas & Mack Center, Las Vegas (HBO), Timothy Bradley vs. Brandon Rios, 12, for Bradley’s WBO welterweight title; Vasyl Lomachenko vs. Romulo Koasicha, 12, for Lomachenko’s WBO featherweight title. 
At Echo Arena, Liverpool, England, Josh King vs. Ricky Burns, 12, for the WBO Inter-Continental lightweight title. Nov. 13 
At Biloxi, Miss. (Spike TV), Edwin Rodriguez vs. Michael Seals, 10, light heavyweights; Frank Galarza vs. Jarrett Hurd, 10, junior middleweights. Nov. 20 
At Cosmopolitan, Las Vegas (truTV), Gilberto Ramirez vs. Juan Camilo Novoa, 10, for the WBA FEDEBOL super middleweight title; Saul Rodriguez vs. Ivan Najera, 10, lightweights. Nov. 21 
At Manchester Arena, Lancashire, England, Darleys Perez vs. Anthony Crolla, 12, for Perez’s WBA World lightweight title. 
At Mandalay Bay Hotel & Casino, Las Vegas (PPV), Miguel Cotto vs. Canelo Alvarez, 12, for Cotto’s WBC middleweight title; Takashi Miura vs. Francisco Vargas, 12, for Miura’s WBC junior lightweight title; Randy Caballero vs. Lee Haskins, 12, for Caballero’s IBF bantamweight title; Jayson Velez vs. Ronny Rios, 10, featherweights. Nov. 24 
At Bangkok, Wanheng Menayothin vs. Young Gil Bae, 12, for Menayothin’s WBC minimumweight title. Nov. 25 
At Hialeah (Fla.) Park Racing and Casino (ESPN), Erislandy Lara vs. Jan Zaveck, 12, for Lara’s WBA World junior middleweight title. Nov. 28 
At Sendai, Japan, Pedro Guevara vs. Yu Kimura, 12, for Guevara’s WBC junior flyweight title; Carlos Cuadras vs. Koki Eto, 12, for Cuadras’ WBC junior bantamweight title; Gamaliel Diaz vs. Takahiro Ao, 10, lightweights. 
At Dusseldorf, Germany (HBO), Wladimir Klitschko vs. Tyson Fury, 12, for Klitschko’s WBA-WBO-IBF heavyweight title. 
At the Videotron Centre, Quebec City, Quebec (SHO), Eleider Alvarez vs. Isaac Chilemba, 12, light heavyweights; James DeGale vs. Lucian Bute, 12, for DeGale’s IBF super middleweight title. Dec. 5 
At TBA, Germany, Fedor Chudinov vs. Felix Sturm, 12, for Chudinov’s WBA World super middleweight title. 
At Barclays Center, Brooklyn, N.Y. (SHO), Daniel Jacobs vs. Peter Quillin, 12, for Jacobs’ WBA World middleweight title; Jesus Cuellar vs. Jonathan Oquendo, 12, for Cuellar’s WBA World featherweight title; Denis Shafikov vs. Rances Barthelemy, 12, for the vacant IBF lightweight title. Topics:
